Message.Title: Tegra problem
Message.Msg: I use a HTC one x running tegra. Just surfing the net and it heats up. Once it heats up, turns laggy. How to compete with others ? Fyi, I am a fan of Nvidia but it really disappoints. For past 5 months, it makes small higher monthly high and higher lows. But this month, it broke lasts month small range low. What a weak stock performance. Now if it breaks $11.90, it breaks the last quarter's small range. Meaning? Meaning it will go down the tubes into single digits! Pos

Topic.Title: Tegra problem

Message.Msg: I have the same phone. I have no problems surfing and checking email ect. I agree however that playing intense graphics games make it heat up. But do remember that it is made in 40nm. You can use job-list to kill undesired tasks running in the background. Maybe you have in running for too long without ever booting it. Regarding the stock - Nvidia has so many new initiatives in the making that are worthwhile waiting for. Enjoy the dividend in the meantime. Take care /Frank.

Topic.Title: Tegra problem

Message.Msg: Since you quoted $ numbers, I assume you live in the US? Well, the version of HTC One X released in US and North America deployed Qualcomm S4 SoC, not Tegra 3. Nice try,

Topic.Title: Tegra problem

Message.Msg: Nice try your head. Am from Asia. My HTC one x is from their original release. Nothing but a disappointment. Yes, frank, Nvidia has lots of initiatives. But follow through is so weak. Lots of promises, but never delivers, what's the point? They seem to try throwing everything on the wall hoping it sticks. But it doesn't. It stinks instead. Lol Look at facts, even when they are earlier then mediatek to fight with qcom, Nvidia lose to mediatek pants down. Shame on them. If u have a portfolio and Nvidia only a small percentage of it, its fine. But if u bet big on it, move on and dun waste money. At least not yet. Til it crosses $13, else forget about it.

Topic.Title: Tegra problem

Message.Msg: I am in US and have the HTC One X+ with tegra 3 chip. Hey I like it! YEs it will heat up if you play say a half hour of videos, etc. but never enough to care about. I have never seen a 'lag' after heating up.

Topic.Title: Tegra problem

Message.Msg: I use the HTC one X with snap dragon which heats up enough that I have to remove it from my pocket. Wish I got the one with Tegra 3. FYI, the new HTC one X is available in USA with tegra 3 in the last month.

Topic.Title: Tegra problem

Message.Msg: What you describe is not a Tegra only problem. I've got HTC phone with rather older Snapdragon chip. It gets hot sometimes as well, but it has nothing to with speed or lags as it's slow all the time. :-) I would happily changed the phone for your One X if I could.

Topic.Title: Tegra problem

Message.Msg: I wish Nvidia strong heydays do come back. But they must stop making promises and start delivering. I also suspect its shield project is a decoy for sub performance delivery. Case in point. Look at its project Denver. Where is it now? No updates at all. Til its shares price start to breakout and hold, else it is just hope on investors part. Look at goldbugs, said with QE3 or 4 gold gonna rally big. After several months gold drop along with miners. I bought gdx at fifties late last yr. Kept cutting losses. Moved on and stop looking at it. Now its 34. So better not to listen to hopes but instead, listen to price!

Message.Title: Just suppose...
Message.Msg: I have NO idea what FB is about to announce, but just suppose for a moment that it IS a phone, and then just suppose that they decided to use Tegra 4i in it instead of a QCOM chip. That would certainly qualify as a MAJOR catalyst and announcement for NVDA, and although most pundits say that isn't what they're going to introduce, I will simply say that it seems "interesting" that just as NVDA started to turn higher, earlier, QCOM, which HAD been higher, turned lower in a hurry. I sure wouldn't want to be short ANY calls if that happens. As always, we'll know in the fullness of time. Max

Topic.Title: Just suppose...

Message.Msg: Well, I guess NOT. Still seems odd the way QCOM moved lower so quickly while NVDA is higher in a down market. Perhaps something else is coming.

Topic.Title: Just suppose...

Message.Msg: One could safely assume that somewhere, somehow, that Tegra 4 will get a win that's unique. Just the fact that it's Tegra 4 already makes it different from everything else out there... And if it's not replacing an existing slot... there's always new devices No doubt NVidia has cooked up a ready to go platform Tegra 4 will also be devastating on price for its die size is very small... As for a 4i ... availability 2014 ... unfortunate, but it's the way it is... Maybe some announcements EOY...

Message.Title: A brief history of "FaceBook Phone" rumors
Message.Msg: March 2013 rumor: FB phone specs leaked; hardware includes a dual-core 1.5GHz processor... If this is true, it would sound like the FB phone is powered by the old QC S4 Krait - can't possibly be Tegra 2... Topic.Title: A brief history of "FaceBook Phone" rumors

Message.Msg: Also, it's going to be ready for the LTE network and I thought the one thing left in the process for T4i with ATT et al was getting certification. Maybe the use of an older Qualcomm chip and the cheaper price of the phone implies there will be an entry point later for the T4i chip in similar models of mid-range phones with the FB Home pre-installed. Seems like any reaction to this FB press conference was muted for semi-conductors, but at least Nvidia is up today.

Message.Title: WSJ comments on FaceBook press event today
Message.Msg: While Facebook isn’t building its own phone exactly, it is creating all the tools a hardware maker needs to create such a device. In addition to making Facebook Home available as a software download, CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the company has crafted a set of tools for phone makers to include Home from the outset. The company has a list of hardware makers and carriers already interested in doing such devices, including Samsung, Sony, Huawei and Alcatel One Touch. As we reported more than a year ago, the first partner will be HTC, which is creating a phone to be sold with AT&T. HTC chief Peter Chou appeared onstage on Thursday to show off the aptly named HTC First, which will be the first device to carry Facebook Home as its default interface. The phone, which will sell for $99.99 and go on sale April 12, will come in red, white, light blue and black. Preorders start today. AT&T Mobility chief Ralph de la Vega said the HTC First is a canvas on which to show off what Facebook has done. “It’s simple and it;s elegant,” de la Vega said.

Topic.Title: "Google's next Nexus 7 tablet will shun Nvidia in favour of Qualcomm"

Message.Msg: "Google apparently favoured a Qualcomm chip for "power reasons", according to Reuters' unnamed source." I know you Nvidia fans have that "power reasons" issue on ignore BUT I bet Nvidia IS NOT IGNORING Google. I bet Nvidia listened to EVERY WORD Google had to say about "power reasons" and is seriously trying to fix Tegra 4 to be competive with QCOMs part. Now don't you think Nvidia would do that? Even if you want to pretend there is no problem? lol imho

Topic.Title: "Google apparently favoured a Qualcomm chip for "power reasons" "

Message.Msg: Well, it's you who knows nothing. It could have been the trade-off between performance and power efficiency. Google might have chosen Tegra 4 with better performance but bigger battery or Snapdragon with lower performance and thinner (and cheaper) battery. Google Nexus like of products is well known not for being "the best" but "good enough". Other vendors might find Tegra 4 more suitable for their strategy. Although you're right it's a loss for Nvidia, it's not a proof that Tegra 4 is a failure as you try to suggest.

Topic.Title: "Google apparently favoured a Qualcomm chip for "power reasons" "

Message.Msg: "Tegra 4 with better performance but bigger battery" So are you saying that Tegra 4 requires a bigger battery, isn't that Google reportedly said, "power reasons"? lol "Google Nexus like of products is well known not for being "the best" but "good enough" " So does that mean they went with Tegra 3 because its not the best but was good enough until it wasn't good enough when compared to the competition so Google UPGRADED to QCOM for the NEW Nexus? Is what you meant but didn't know it? imho

Topic.Title: "Google apparently favoured a Qualcomm chip for "power reasons" "

Message.Msg: You're not getting any of my shares with your countless posts bashing this stock. If you're long, just sell the stock and stop worrying about every single design win or lose! Other wise short the stock and keep rambling - lol!

Topic.Title: "Google apparently favoured a Qualcomm chip for "power reasons" "

Message.Msg: What you find odd on performance vs. power efficiency trade-off? I repeat: nexus line of products are "good enough" (and yes, Tegra 3 is just of this kind) and focus not on pure performance but mainly on price. So the chances are that they considered Tegra 4 for its performance, but it needed bigger battery to reach the same level of "battery life" as not so performance strong Snapdragon. So they might have decided to go with Snapdragon even if they know they wouldn't hit the highest scores in benchmarks but holding to their price targets due to lower battery capacity and price.

Message.Title: Rumors re. Nexus 7 next-gen surfaced today
Message.Msg: Base price (minimum storage; no LTE): $149 Google will probably subsidize it heavily. it might not fly even with heavy subsidy - case in point: Nexus 10 turned out to be a flop by Google standards. No WOW appeal like the N7.

Message.Title: Notebook shipments to rise 8% in Q2
Message.Msg: "Worldwide notebook computer shipments will post better-than-expected figures in the second quarter of this year thanks to launches of new chips and ultra-thin laptops, as well as a recovery in hard drive disk supply, a British investment bank predicted. After three consecutive quarters of lower-than-average seasonal shipments, Barclays Capital is looking for personal computer shipments to beat seasonal expectations for the first time in four quarters. The bank expects notebook shipments from top-tier Taiwanese original design manufacturers (ODMs) to grow 8 percent in the second quarter of this year and hit 39.8 million units, better than the seasonal average of 6 percent growth. ...... SOURCE: taipeitimesDOTcom/News/biz/archives/2012/04/05/2003529509

Topic.Title: If you build it, they will come

Message.Msg: Xiaomi traditionally uses QC chips due to QC's investment. Xiaomi MI-3, however, is rumored to use Tegra 4 instead S800. In-Cell Display, TD-LTE. GA Oct 2013. G-translate: news.mydriversDOTcom/1/259/259462.htm

Topic.Title: If you build it, they will come

Message.Msg: Findingnemoyes: Thanks for posting the article and update of Xiaomi Mi-3, I hope it is the final version. Over the past few months, the story flipped back and forth a number of times - first it was Tegra 4, then it was changed to QC S800, now we are back to the original version. I am glad Tegra 4 is still in the race as a leading candidate, as Xiaomi is the Apple in China with unbelievable cult following. The previous Xiaomi Mi-1 and Mi-2 were sold out within days.. At least that was what I read on the Internet and exactly what my friends from China told me. So...product launch in summer and release in the fall. If this is true, we will be talking about 5-10 million units at launch on a conservative estimate.

Message.Title: Nvidia's competition is Rockchip, Mediatek, Allwinner...
